messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] looking for resources
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/29/2003 12:45:56 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Google Home Education Magazine & Life Learning magazine. Get back copies of Growing
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/29/2003 12:45:56 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
red2mickey@... writes:


> i am looking for any resources i can find to order actuall magizines
> to lay on my coffee table so that when i have company they can pick
> them up and read about homeschooling and suches,,i feel it will help
> so i wont have to asnwer all those idiotic questions people ask me
> once they realize i home school,i can say here read about it for your
> self,,lol,,so i need any links or address that you can give me to
> order maybe a year or so subcricption from,,,,

Google "Home Education Magazine" & "Life Learning" magazine. Get back copies
of "Growing Without Schooling" from F.U.N. Books (Nancy & Billy Greer)

You're also close to the Live & Learn Unschooling Conference in Columbia,
SC---at least in the general Southern region. <g>

www.unschooling.com ---you can print out TONS of stuff there and make your
own "book".

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] looking for resources
messages.msgSnippet: ** i am looking for any resources i can find to order actuall magizines to lay on my coffee table so that when i have company they can pick them up and read
messages.messageBody:
** i am looking for any resources i can find to order actuall magizines
to lay on my coffee table so that when i have company they can pick
them up and read about homeschooling and suches,,i feel it will help
so i wont have to asnwer all those idiotic questions people ask me
once they realize i home school,i can say here read about it for your
self,,lol,,so i need any links or address...**


In addition to magazines, you might also like Linda Dobson's book, The
Homeschooling Book of Answers. It includes lots of info about relaxed
homeschooling and unschooling. The book is divided into 83 questions
with 2 or 3 answers from experienced homeschoolers, including Sandra and
others on this list. Typical answers are less than a page long, so it's
an easy book to pick up and dip into. You could even bookmark the
questions that come up over and over. <g>

Betsy

messages.subject: looking for resources
messages.msgSnippet: i am looking for any resources i can find to order actuall magizines to lay on my coffee table so that when i have company they can pick them up and read about
messages.messageBody:
i am looking for any resources i can find to order actuall magizines
to lay on my coffee table so that when i have company they can pick
them up and read about homeschooling and suches,,i feel it will help
so i wont have to asnwer all those idiotic questions people ask me
once they realize i home school,i can say here read about it for your
self,,lol,,so i need any links or address that you can give me to
order maybe a year or so subcricption from,,,,i would also like to
know your opions on any you may have already gotten ,and if they
helped you with getting others to realize we are not wierd because we
homeschool,,well unschool rather..i think it would do hubby good to
just to see that there are more unschooler out there than just our
family,,so maybe if i through around these books then he could read
them also..sorry for the rambling on...

regina.....proud mom of an unschooling family of 4 boys,,ages 10 to
14 located here in downhome alabama..lol
